titleInfo.title: USA v. Hawkins
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding 10 Motion to Suppress Evidence as to James Vaughn Hawkins. Motion is set for hearing on October 11, 2005 at 9:00 a.m. before Magistrate Judge F.A. Gossett. Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 8/19/2005. (MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER regarding 10 Motion to Suppress Evidence as to James Vaughn Hawkins. Motion is set for hearing on October 11, 2005 at 9:00 a.m. before Magistrate Judge F.A. Gossett. Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 8/19/2005. (MLF, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hawkins
titleInfo.subTitle: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION/ORDER. It is recommended to Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon that the Motion to Suppress 10 be denied in all respects. It is ordered that the clerk shall cause an expedited transcript of the hearing to be prepared and filed. Pursuant to NECrimR 57.3, any objection to this Report and Recommendation shall be filed with the Clerk of the Court within ten (10) days after the transcript is available to counsel. Failure to timely object may constitute a waiver of any such objection. The brief in support of any objection shall be filed at the time of filing such objection. Failure to file a brief in support of any objection may be deemed an abandonment of the objection as to defendant James Vaughn Hawkins. Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 10/11/2005. (MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hawkins
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to James Vaughn Hawkins (1), Count 1, Defendant pleaded guilty to count I of the Indictment and is committed to custody of Bureau of Prisons for 27 months; 3 years supervised release with special conditions; $100.00 specal assessment as to defendant James Vaughn Hawkins. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 4/17/2006. (4 certified copies given to US Marshal) (ADB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hawkins
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding PETITION FOR OFFENDER UNDER SUPERVISION 44; the Office of the Federal Public Defender is appointed to represent this defendant in this matter; an evidentiary hearing in this matter is scheduled in Courtroom 3, Third Floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 South 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska, at 1:00 p.m., on April 7, 2009; defendant must be present in person; defendant is released on the same terms and conditions of supervised release already imposed as to defendant James Vaughn Hawkins. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (CJP)
